main_definition: In simple terms, 'analog' refers to something that is similar or comparable in certain aspects but not exactly the same, particularly when comparing it with digital technology.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Referring to a representation of data using continuous physical phenomena
meanings_and_examples.example: An analog clock uses moving hands on a dial to represent time.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Relating to or resembling something in form, nature, or characteristics
meanings_and_examples.example: Analogous colors are those that are adjacent to each other on the color wheel and share similarities.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Describing a system or device that operates using continuously varying quantities rather than discrete values
meanings_and_examples.example: An analog television uses continuous waves of frequencies to transmit images, as opposed to digital TV which encodes signals into binary data.
